result.execSummary:
The defendant Clarence J Beal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Amount of $1,539.10 as follows:  $186.85 to the Crime Victim Compensation Program; $801.75 to Seth H.; $457.00 to Maria J.-M.; and $93.50 to Gabriela D.-P.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements on each count, after restitution is paid.
**Court ordered monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid, balance would convert to a civil judgment.

02-15-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Conen
The Court ordered the JOC shall be amended to include a TOTAL of 224 days of sentence credit on count four.  The 219 days of credit on count eight are vacated and shall be removed from the judgment.
Credit for 224 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment and/or schooling for 40 hours a week.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.   Absolute sobriety.  No controlled substances or alcohol.   Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Petition for sentence adjustment returned as premature.
Per order dated August 14, 2019, Appeal No. 2016AP1817-CR , IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.
Letter to the Defendant from Wisconsin Supreme Court regarding Petition for Review, received.

per order dated April 9, 2019, Appeal No. 2019AP505-W (2015CF1189) and 2016AP1817-CR (2015CF1189), IT IS ORDERED that the document filed by the SPD on March 12, 2019, will be construed as a petition for writ of habeas corpus. The petition for writ of habeas corpus is granted; and 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that petitioner may file, pursuant to the procedures of Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(4), a no-merit petition for review from the adverse court of appeals' decision issued on September 12, 2017, State v. Beal, No. 2016AP1817-CR, with the assistance of appointed counsel, no later than 30 days from the date of this order. See Schmelzer, 201 Wis. 2d at 255-56; and 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rules 809.32(4) and 809.62, petitioner may file a supplemental petition with the clerk of this court by May 9, 2019. The supplemental petition shall state reasons in support of review and satisfy the requirements of Rule 809.62(2)(a), (b), (c), and (e). If no supplemental petition is filed within the prescribed time, this matter will be submitted to the court for appropriate action; and 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin, shall file its response to the no-merit petition for review and any supplemental petition on or before May 23, 2019. The parties will thereafter be notified in due course of this court's disposition of the no-merit petition for review.
Denying Motion for Reconsideration; signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. mag

received and filed.

Defendant Clarence J Beal in court with Attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Clarence J Beal in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  AS TO COUNTS #1, #2, #3, and #5:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.    

AS TO COUNTS #4, #6, #7 and #8:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

The Court advised parties that the Information needed to be amended due to the wrong fines in counts #4 and #6.  The State nor defense have any objection to the Court amending the fines.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

The matter is adjourned for sentencing on October 23, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
